Assert Your Right to Vote

Voter Resource Center

Voting is vital to a strong democracy. Our Voter Resource Center provides important information on voting in the 2020 US elections. You also can check out votercadechallenge.com for tips on how to make voting fun!

Featured News

Why You Should Get Google Reviews for Your Local Services Ads

Did you know your Local Services Ad (LSA) has its own review platform that is completely separate from your GMB reviews? You should always continue to get reviews through your Google My Business (GMB) listing, but if you are running LSAs, you should also get reviews directly on your LSA profile.
Read More

Tip of the Month

Do You Offer Onsite Services and/or Online Appointments?

Google My Business allows business owners to set various attributes to let customers know what the business has to offer. Some of these attributes may be displayed in the Local searches on Google. Due to COVID-19, Google added "Onsite services" and "Online appointments" as attributes so business owners can specify the kind of services they are providing during this time.

Keep your business information up to date on Google and let your clients know the service you offer!
Learn More

Tech News

Facebook and Twitter CEOs to Attend Hearing About Section 230 Protections

Mark Zuckerberg and Jack Dorsey will testify before the Senate Commerce Committee on protections for online platforms from legal liability for content posted by their users.

The Justice Department has filed its antitrust lawsuit against Google

The DOJ joins 11 states in arguing that Google is maintaining illegal monopolies in the markets for general search services, search advertising, and general search text advertising.

Congressional Antitrust Report Into Apple and Others Delayed as Two Sides Negotiate

Republican and Democrat members of the committee agree that antitrust concerns require greater oversight of the tech industry, but they have not agreed on an appropriate solution.

Instagram Starts Labeling ‘State-controlled Media’ Accounts and Posts

Labels will appear on Instagram profile pages and posts, identifying content from media outlets that are believed to be at least partly under the editorial control of their government.

SEO News

Google Ads Intros Automated Insights, Performance Max Campaigns, to Release Video Action Out of Beta

Google continues to move forward in its effort to use machine learning to serve campaigns across many of its properties as it responds to the exigencies of the COVID-19 pandemic.

Google My Business Adds More COVID-19 Health & Safety Checks

Additional health and safety attributes that have been integrated into the GMB local listings include safety dividers at checkout and a policy of disinfecting surfaces between visits.

Google Introduces Song Matching via Singing, Humming, or Whistling

A new Google feature will allow people to identify a song through the app or widget by tapping the microphone, asking to search a song, and then humming, whistling, or singing the song.

Google My Business to Log Recent Customer Calls

A new feature in Google My Business will allow businesses to see recent customer calls that were triggered by search results, although it remains in an early stage of development.

Internet Stats

Most Popular Social Media Apps in the U.S.

by monthly users (in millions)

Source: Statista

Facebook is still the most popular social network in the U.S. Thus, you should include Facebook in your marketing mix. A major benefit of Facebook advertising is its ability to reach your exact audience.

Social Media News

Facebook Announces #BuyBlack Friday Campaign In Support of Black Owned Businesses

Between October 30 and November 27, a campaign will urge users to buy Black-owned brands during the Black Friday retail event as part of the Holiday Hub “Season of Support.”

Facebook Bans Holocaust Denial Amid Rapid Rise in “Deceptive” Content

In a reversal of controversial policies, Facebook is strengthening its enforcement against hate speech and misinformation in response to a perceived rise in anti-Semitism worldwide.

Guide to Navigating Social Media During the Election

Explore these tips for reducing the risk of misinformation on social media regarding the November election and learn about what major outlets are doing to address this issue.

How to Improve Your Branding on Instagram

Designer Kat Coroy explains how to find your unique brand style and translate it to an Instagram profile, while improving your Instagram images and taking more effective selfies.

Legal Industry News

Secrecy Sleeves and the “Naked Ballot”

At least 16 states will provide inner envelopes to absentee voters to protect their privacy in the November election. States diverge on whether ballots without secrecy sleeves will count.

Ballot Drop-Off Options in All 50 States

This resource describes the availability of ballot drop boxes in each state and identifies the locations where voters can drop off completed ballots before and on Election Day.

Ruling Against Yelp in S.F. Court Bars Recording Either Side of Phone Conversation Without Both Parties’ Consent

According to a state appeals court judge, California privacy law requires all the participants in a conversation to consent to recording, even if only one participant is being recorded.

New Jury Instructions Strengthen Social Media Cautions

A federal judiciary committee has provided an updated set of model jury instructions to federal judges to help them warn jurors against using social media to research or discuss cases.

California Bar Exam Takers Say Facial Recognition Software Rejected Them

Many non-white test takers have said that they were forced to shine lights in their faces or submit selfies to enter various sections of the exam after the software rejected them.

When AI Hurts People, Who Is Held Responsible?

A UCLA law school professor has published a paper arguing that artificial intelligence creates tension with the traditional legal theory of negligence and requires intervention by regulators.
